channel.title: +०२ on यजुर्वेदे विश्वासटिप्पन्यः
channel.description: Recent content in +०२ on यजुर्वेदे विश्वासटिप्पन्यः

item.title: THE SECOND LAYER.
item.description: 01 He lays down the second layer. For now the gods, having laid down the first layer, mounted it. But, indeed, the first layer is this (terrestrial) world: it is this same world which, when completed, they mounted. 02 They spake, ‘Meditate ye!’–whereby, doubtless, they meant to say, ‘Seek ye a layer! Seek ye (to build) from hence upwards!’ Whilst meditating, they saw this second layer: what there is above the earth, and on this side of the atmosphere, that world was to their mind, as it were, unfirm and unsettled.

item.title: UNKNOWN_TITLE
item.description: 01 He then lays down the Vaiśvadevī (All-gods’ bricks). For this second layer is that one which the Aśvins at that time laid down for them (the gods); and by laying it down they became everything here whatsoever there is here. 02 The gods spake, ‘The Aśvins have become everything here: think ye upon this as to how we also may share in it!’ They said, ‘Meditate ye (cit)!’ whereby, no doubt, they meant to say, Seek ye a layer (citi)!

item.title: UNKNOWN_TITLE
item.description: 01 He then lays down the Prāṇabhr̥t (bricks). For at that time the gods said, ‘Meditate ye!’ whereby, doubtless, they meant to say, ‘Seek ye a layer!’ Whilst meditating, they saw even that layer, the wind: they put it into that (fire-altar), and in like manner does he (the priest) now put it therein. 02 He lays down the Prāṇabhr̥ts,–wind, doubtless, is breath: it is wind (air) he thus bestows Upon him (Agni).

item.title: UNKNOWN_TITLE
item.description: 01 ‘The he-goat is vigour 1,’–the he-goat he overtook by his vigour;–‘gapless the metre,’– the gapless metre, doubtless, is the Ekapadā: in the form of Ekapadā (metre) the goats indeed went forth (from Prajāpati). 02 ‘The ram is vigour,’–the ram he overtook by his vigour;–‘ample the metre,’–the ample metre, doubtless, is the Dvipadā: in the form of the Dvipadā the sheep indeed went forth. 03 ‘Man is vigour,’–the man he overtook by his vigour;–‘slow the metre,’–the slow metre, doubtless, is the Paṅkti: in the form of the Paṅkti the men indeed went forth.
